reviews.review_msg: An erudite professor who exudes first-rate scholarly brilliance that has graced the halls of SFU over the last several decades with her sagacious academic preeminence, one of which will probably never be seen again. It is so depressing to see that this summer will be her last semester prior to her exalted retirement. A gem that'll be dearly missed

Boring slow lectures which just feel like rambling because she never has a complete thought. Group work where students come up with the exam questions. Very strict on citations but doesn't really care about content so marks are easy to earn.
She was really nice and class was always light.

It's interesting if you want to learn the Japanese perspective of the Asia-Pacific War. The prof really pushes students to think differently and presents a lot of critical thinking and her own unique perspectives. There's a 35% essay, 25% participation, 10% presentation proposal & 25% presentation on the final exam period. Prepare well before!

Janice might come off as a little scary (when she's talking about the papers she's just graded) at first.  And yes, she does stand at the front and read off a paper.  She does this because she's well prepared and has the information well-organized.  She's got a wonderfully dry sense of humour.  I highly recommend any of her classes.
Love her dry sense of humour! Follow her advice on your paper proposals and you will be fine, fair marker and really helpful if you go see her in office hours

This professor was really good.I recommend her to any students majoring in history.She is not an easy marker but she was very fair and comments were helpful.She was interested in the material and was very informative.For paper proposals:take he advice and you will do great!In some classes u read things & never discuss them,not in this class.

How can anyone not like Janice? You have to love her for the great sarcastic remarks she adds in her lectures to make class interesting. I loved her balanced view about what seems to be some of the most contested and emotionally charged historical issues in the world. She is AWESOME!

She's a bit frightening at first but really nice once you talk to her. Sarcastic. Fast talker. Fair Marker. Takes attendance in tutorials. Overall, I'd recommend her & would take a class with her again. Not too hard, but not the easiest class I've taken either. Essay topics were difficult b/c they were very limited in choice.
Great Class, large amount of detail... but interesting! Very sarcastic teacher... but is very helpful on the essays, but can scare you before she hands an essay back, even if you know you did well.
